newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL tin ends four cents up at 13.78 cents/kg.
newsitem.headline: KL tin ends four cents up at 13.78 cents/kg.

text.p: Malaysia's tin price rose four cents to 13.78 ringgit ($5.49) a kg on Wednesday after tracking a steady overnight close on the London Metal Exchange (LME), traders said.
"There was some good buying after the LME closed unchanged last night, but the rise was stunted by selling," said a trader.
He said the market's next resistance level appeared to be 14 ringgit. "The price should go up after it has hit the 27-month low in recent days."
Bids outnumbered offers by 122 tonnes to 94. Final turnover was 94 tonnes, against 113 on Tuesday. The premium against London widened to $95 a tonne from $55 previously.
